page.text: 21 MIDLAND STREET
COLD SPRING HARBOR, N.Y. 11724
CNOFI@INDIANA.EDU
School of Public and Environmental Affairs
Bachelor of Science in Arts Administration
Major: Arts Management; Minor: Entrepreneurship/Small Business Management; Cumulative GPA: 3.07
Head of A&R (intern) for Aaron Chandler
Talent: (Eliphant Quiz, Forest Rambler, Before the Streetlights, -)
• Scout for talent at shows and online looking for artists to record that fit criteria, effectively increasing artist roster
• Conduct sales with artists outside of criteria for other services (practice space, prepaid demos, production, etc.)
• Assist in CD manufacturing and distribution, stocking CDs at local stores and selling products at shows
• Provide support to artists from signing to release date through to end of promotion period, assist in live event
booking, promotion, and management
Intern for Jan Hewitt and Sumit Bothra
Talent: (Brother & Bones, Fink, The Staves, Ethan Johns, PJ Harvey)
• Maintained merchandise accounts, documenting sales, stock-taking, and selling products at shows
• Archived information for royalty distribution through BMG, and organized materials for PRS
• Assisted in the maintenance of online presence of artists, consistently updating product files for online sales
• Organized logistics for U.S & European tours, planed and sourced travel and hospitality options based on budget
and worked with talent at shows when possible
Intern for Alan Gibson
• Corresponded with press, blogs, and other media outlets to promote events and merchandise
• Developed and directed fundraising campaign through Indiegogo, increasing company funds
• Scouted venues for live events, collaborated with promoters and audio/visual artists on production logistics
Marketing Department; CEO Kadeem Goddard
Talent: (Jayali, Anna Marie, Corporate Boy, Seven, Tinman)
• Managed artists working to develop talent, and create concepts, outlines, and timelines for projects and releases
• Budgeted funds for live events, managed ticket sales and maintained accounting records
• Enlisted partners and sponsors for monthly events, increasing financial support and community awareness
• Recruited and managed street team to promote artists and events locally

text.b: Back In the Game Entertainment, Inc.

page.text: Intern for Anthony Butler, (“A.B.”)
Talent: (J.B Smoove, Lil Jaxe, The Cranberry Show, Elan Luz Rivera)
• Developed and maintained company website, increasing web traffic and web presence
• Helped brainstorm promotional campaigns and music video concepts as well as layout plan, budget, and timeline
• Corresponded with radio stations and magazines to distribute music, videos, and other promo/press kits
Summer Intern for Chris Lighty
Talent: (50 Cent, Busta Rhymes, Diggy Simmons,-)
• Maintained records for meetings and attended listening sessions with other managers
• Organized management information for artists, product lines, and promotional campaigns and distributed it to
other professionals within the company
• Collaborated with A&R professionals, producers, and music publishers to launch new projects and secure
endorsement and sponsorship deals
• A&R, artist development, music management, live event booking
• Computer Skills: Microsoft Excell, Microsoft Access, Wordpress, Topsin, Musicglue, social media
